page.title: 14A DERBY SCHOOLGIRL'S DAY
page.content: At 7.15 I am woken by the sound of my electronic alarm clock. Mother makes my breakfast of cornflakes and "jungle juice" before we leave home in the car. She drops me off at school on her way to work. Dad is lucky - he works near enough to walk. We have so many bags that it looks as though we are going on holiday. School starts at 8.50 with calling of the register and then all the girls assemble in the hall for a short Christian service of worship. We have eight lessons during the day and lunch is served in school. During the lunch hour there are sporting and musical activities while a few girls use the school's computers which are still a bit of a novelty. Today I have to rush to ballet studio after school and it's 7.00 before the family sits down to a meal. After that it's homework and TV then bed at 9.00.
